description.narrative: "This project is implemented by Oxfam Hong Kong from 2013 to 2015. The overall goal of the project is to reduce poverty, increase livelihood diversification and enhance resilience of the poor and ethnic minorities and women in the poorest areas of Vietnam, through pro-poor value chain development of tea. Nghe An is one of the 10 major tea growing provinces in Vietnam, with tea being cultivated in 6 districts (i.e. Thanh Chuong, Anh Son, Con Cuong, Quy Hop, Que Phong and Ky Son) benefiting around 14,000households. The average annual production yields about 9-10 tons/ha (compared to the national average of 7.7 tons/ha). Nghe An has the potential to become the best province in terms of health safety standards (organic) for tea production. Compared to other districts, Ky Son is the only one producing Shan tea (instead of other export varieties of black tea, such as LPD1 LPD2, PH1) and Thanh Chuong is the biggest district producing tea in Nghe An with the majority of exporting products as Black tea Orthodox, black tea CTC and Orthodox green tea. In this project, we work closely with the Youth Union 8 and 10 (YU) in Ky Son District. They have been Oxfam partner for few years on tea development. As an effort to improve villagers# livelihood, the YU not only organize farmers in tea production but also collect tea leaves and process and sell to the domestic markets. Youth Union No.8 and No.10 were established in 2003 with the purposeof providing technical and trade support to tea farmers in the area of Huoi Tu, Muong Long communes, Ky Son districts. YU No. 8 and10 are the sole buyers in the tea areas. 64% of YU8#s revenue in 2012 came from the farming, processing, and trading of tea, while the rest came from other activities such as the production of teaand other forestry seeds, poultry and cattle farming, etc. Oxfam works with VITAS to build capacity of YU to enable them to produce higher quality products, selling them at higher prices, as a result, indirectly, increases the income for the local tea growers. Overall objective: To effectively support the sustainable development of tea values chain for the poor and ethnic minorities in Nghe An province. 4 specific objectives: # Improve tea cultivation and production practices, public awareness of local communities in Thanh Chuong district, Nghe An province towards clean and safe production # Support tea production processes and management system in Ky Son district, Nghe An province for clean and safe products with vision to organic tea production # Improve market penetration and market linkages of tea producers in Ky Son province to domestic and international markets # Facilitate and enable business and policy environments for the sustainable development of tea sector in Nghe An province

participating-org.narrative:
RECERD is a non-governmental organization (NGO)- not-for-profit, based in Hanoi, under the Vietnam Union of Science and Technology (VUSTA), operating according to the permission No A958 of Minister of Ministry of Science and Technology (MOST) issued on January 30, 2011.
RECERD has duty to promote sound demonstrations of good practices in natural resources conservation and rural poor people in Vietnam, improving livelihoods of local people through community development, capacity building for advocacy and policy influencing. RECERD is the active member of Good Governance Working Group (GOGE) in Vietnam; Alliance of Action for Civil societies Vietnam (CSO Vietnam); Civil Society inclusion in food security and poverty elimination network (CIFPEN), VietnamFisheries Association Society(VINAFIS), Land Alliance (LANDA), and Vietnam River Network (VRN).
RECERD has 28 people, including advisory boards, board of directors, and employees that include 03 associate professors, 07 PhD, 10 masters, 07 bachelors and engineers, 01 intermediate level and social workers. In addition, RECERD has a network of collaborators; numerous of youths and volunteers are concentrated in the coast of Vietnam. The RECERD works for its missions on #for the green future# which focuses on three dimensions below:
1) Contribution tonatural conservation and rational use of natural resources for today and tomorrow 2) Enhance the welfare of women and other marginalized groups: children and teenagers-the green generations of Vietnam 3) Put efforts to work for justice between generations, for equality between social groups in Vietnam.
Major past experiences RECERD has successfully conducted and delivered more than 40 projects related to responsible fisheries and aquaculture in Vietnam. RECERD is one of leading organizations in providing consultancy services on community based fisheries co-management for Rockefeller (2012); and World Bank funded projects currently in 8 coastal provinces in Vietnam (2013-2015). Some importance primary partners are the Sustainable Fisheries Partnership Foundation (SFP) in coordinating Fisheries Improvement Projects (FIP) for trawl fisheries in Mekong delta, RECERD has been supporting on tuna fishery improvementprojects in central coast of Vietnam. Recently, RECERD was funded by the US Embassy in Hanoi for the topic of #gender in fisheries project in Cat Ba island, Hai Phong province# in 2015; and land dispute issues in Nghe An province (2013).
RECERD has strong partnership with some US based seafood companies to supporting sourcing of sustainable seafood from Vietnam. The list of some selected project of RECERD founded by various donors can be found in website at http://recerd.org.vn/en/du-an/list-projects-update-march-2014.
